result.execSummary:
All charges against Vincent Scott Weinhold in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent Scott Weinhold is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent Scott Weinhold

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is deceased.  On the State's motion, Court ordered case dismissed.
Court set a motion to dismiss hearing date upon request from the State.  Parties notified of date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Vincent Scott Weinhold in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed to address rest of Court's calendar.  

Case recalled at 10:16 am.  ADA Ryan Michaels appeared for the state.  Court will be in trial on another case and unable to hear this case.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent Scott Weinhold in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vincent Scott Weinhold appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on 6/13/2022 at 8:30 am, Courthouse Room 504.

Defendant Vincent Scott Weinhold in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 5-26-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 6-13-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent Scott Weinhold in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional status conference date. Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JML.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Vincent Scott Weinhold in court.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/22/22 @ 1:30p
